pytket._circuit¶

Classes:

  • pytket._circuit.Circuit
  • pytket._circuit.OpType

The _circuit module provides an API to interact with the \(\mathrm{t|ket}\rangle\) Circuit data structure. This module is provided in binary form during the PyPI installation.

class pytket._circuit.Command¶

A single quantum command in the circuit, defined by the Op and qubits it acts on.

bits¶

The bits written to by the command.

controls¶

The bits controlling the command.

op¶

Operation for this command.

qubits¶

The qubits the command acts on.

pytket._circuit.unitary_to_2qb_circuit(matrix: numpy.ndarray[complex128[4, 4]]) → pytket._circuit.Circuit¶

Converts a 4x4 unitary matrix to a minimal two-qubit circuit (with respect to CX count) up to global phase.

Parameters:matrix – The unitary matrix for the desired operation
Returns:The new circuit
pytket._circuit.exponent_to_2qb_circuit(matrix: numpy.ndarray[complex128[4, 4]]) → pytket._circuit.Circuit¶

Given a 4x4 matrix \(H\), returns a two-qubit circuit representing \(e^{iH}\) up to global phase.

Parameters:matrix – The matrix \(H\)
Returns:The new circuit
pytket._circuit.fresh_symbol(preferred: str = 'a') → Symbol¶

Given some preferred symbol, this finds an appropriate suffix that will guarantee it has not yet been used in the current python session.

Parameters:preferred – The preferred readable symbol name as a string (default is ‘a’)
Returns:A new sympy symbol object
